summary: This document is a draft police report detailing the retrieval of Jeffrey Epstein-related case materials from the Palm Beach Police Department's storage facilities. A detective from an unspecified agency, accompanied by Sergeant [REDACTED], accesses a locked storage room and office, obtaining two bankers boxes marked 'Epstein' containing paperwork and physical media, along with digital reports from the department's case management system.

persons.name: Sgt
persons.role: Supervisor of the Palm Beach Police Department's Organized Crime, Vice & Narcotics Unit (Special Investigations)
persons.context: He supervises the Special Investigations unit, provides access to the storage warehouse and office, locates and turns over Epstein case materials (both physical and digital) to the visiting detective, and receives a subpoena.

persons.name: Det
persons.role: Investigating detective from an unspecified agency
persons.context: The visiting detective who is escorted by Sgt to retrieve Epstein case materials from storage, receives physical boxes and digital printouts, and provides a subpoena and property receipt for the items.

connections.description: Sgt, as the local supervisor, assists the visiting Det in locating and obtaining Epstein-related case files from the Palm Beach Police Department's storage and digital systems.

events.title: Retrieval of Epstein Case Materials from Palm Beach PD
events.description: Detective [REDACTED], accompanied by Sergeant [REDACTED], accesses a locked storage room at a Town of Palm Beach warehouse and a Special Investigations office to obtain two physical bankers boxes marked 'Epstein' and digital reports related to the Epstein investigation.

locations: Town of Palm Beach's storage warehouse
Palm Beach Police Department's Special Investigations office
keyFacts: On October 8, 2021, Epstein-related case materials were retrieved from the Palm Beach Police Department's secure storage.
Two specific bankers boxes marked 'Epstein' were obtained, containing various paperwork and physical media.
The materials were stored in a locked room within a town warehouse, accessible only to members of the Special Investigations unit and a records clerk.
Digital case files related to Epstein were also located in the department's case management system and printed for the investigating detective.
A subpoena was served, and a property receipt was issued for the transferred materials, formalizing the chain of custody.
